comment.body: Just updated the entry with a quote from the #namecoin IRC channel.
Nope, but it made me think about why some babies end up as monsters.

> [pycole](#comment_1_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): My favorite monospace fonts: Hack and FSM
> And then there's Fira...

I didn't know FSM and Fira, thanks for the links!

I've been using Hack Regular in the terminal for quite some time now (before that I used Droid Sans Mono for a while), it's a very nice font.

> [hexkey](#comment_1_18NsJqjikBYBjwLzMVp7aBJSpqtyRSd9qF): Possible source

Thanks, I think you're right. Those descriptions are very useful.

> [weakish](#comment_1_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR): Try (7).to_bytes(1, 'big').

I know I can put parentheses around the digit to make it work. Object or not, I think it's a stupid design flaw.
If Python thinks than 2016-12-31T23:59:59Z + 1s is 2017-01-01T00:00:00Z and that 2017-01-01T00:00:00Z - 1s is 2016-12-31T23:59:59Z, how can I ever again trust timedeltas across leap seconds?

Interestingly, we have:
```sh
$ TZ=right/UTC date -d @1483228826
Sat Dec 31 23:59:60 UTC 2016
```
Sadly, however, there is no `[Rr]ight/UTC` zone in the `pytz` module.
